1.t: (On the day) when the sun is made to cease shining,

2.t: the stars are made to fade away,

3.t: the mountains are scattered about as dust,

4.t: the young barren camels are abandoned,

5.t: the wild beasts are herded together,

6.t: the oceans are brought to a boil,

7.t: souls are reunited with their bodies,

8.t: questions are asked about the baby girls buried alive,

9.t: such as, "For what crime were they murdered?"

10.t: the records of deeds are made public,

14.t: then every soul will discover the consequence of its deeds.

15.t: I do not need to swear by the orbiting

16.t: stars which are visible during the night

17.t: and sit during the day, or by the darkening night

19.t: that the Quran is the word of the honorable angelic, mighty Messenger

20.t: who is honored in the presence of the Lord of the Throne,

21.t: obeyed by (all creatures) and faithful to His trust.

22.t: Your companion (Muhammad) does not suffer from any mental illness

23.t: He certainly saw him (Gabriel) high up on the horizon in his original form

24.t: He (Muhammad) is not accused of lying about the unseen.

25.t: The Quran is not the word of condemned satan.

27.t: This is certainly the guidance for all (jinn and mankind).

28.t: So let those who want, choose the right guidance

29.t: However, you will not be able to choose anything unless God, Lord of the Universe wills it to be so.
29.tr: Wa-maa tashaaa'oona illaaa ai yashaaa-'al laahu Rabbul 'Aalameen
